1.title: Concept Space vs Action Space
1.summary: A look into what happens when we mix up descriptive categories with prescriptive ones. Problems from the same category may still have different solutions, and recognizing the similarities is insufficient for a solution.

2.title: Fading Novelty
2.summary: Humans have a natural tendency to get become desensitized to repeated experiences; this is paired with a drive to look for newness. Our urge to seek variety appears to underlie many practical considerations. I outline the phenomenon of fading novelty and give some thoughts on how this can inform the way we live.

3.title: Recognizing vs Generating
3.summary: Two core ways to categorize tasks are Recognizing and Generating. I outline the difference between the two tasks and provide several examples where the distinction proves to be important.
